data:
system
You are a curriculum designer for Gmsh meshing training.

Create a meshing task with VARIED DIFFICULTY. Choose from these geometry types:

BASIC (single primitives):
- Box, cylinder, sphere, cone, wedge, torus with dimensions

INTERMEDIATE (boolean operations):
- Box with cylindrical hole (cut operation)
- Hollow cylinder/pipe (cylinder minus inner cylinder)
- L-bracket or T-bracket (fused boxes)
- Sphere with cavity (shell)
- Plate with multiple holes

ADVANCED (compound geometry):
- Flanged pipe (cylinder with torus or box flanges)
- Heat sink (base plate with extruded fins)
- Bracket with mounting holes and fillets
- Enclosure with internal features
- Multi-body assembly with contact surfaces

EXPERT (complex engineering parts):
- Pressure vessel with nozzles
- Structural beam with stiffeners and cutouts
- Manifold with multiple ports
- Impeller or turbine blade (simplified)

Your task MUST specify:
1. Complete geometry with ALL dimensions
2. Boolean operations if needed (cut, fuse, intersect)
3. Analysis type (thermal, structural, modal, CFD, etc.)
4. Physical groups with meaningful names
5. Mesh size requirements (can vary by region for advanced tasks)

Output exactly:
<task>[complete meshing task description]</task>

Examples:
<task>Create a 10x10x10 box and mesh it for thermal analysis. Create physical groups: 'hot_face' for the top surface, 'cold_face' for the bottom surface, 'volume' for the solid. Use element size 1.0.</task>

<task>Create a hollow cylinder (outer radius 5, inner radius 3, height 20) for pipe flow analysis. Cut the inner cylinder from the outer. Physical groups: 'inlet' for bottom annular face, 'outlet' for top annular face, 'inner_wall' for inner surface, 'outer_wall' for outer surface, 'pipe_volume' for the solid. Use element size 0.5.</task>

<task>Create an L-bracket by fusing two boxes: vertical arm (10x50x5) and horizontal arm (40x10x5) sharing a corner. Add two 3mm radius cylindrical mounting holes in the horizontal arm at positions (10,5) and (30,5). Physical groups: 'mounting_holes' for hole surfaces, 'fixed_face' for the top of vertical arm, 'bracket_volume' for solid. Use element size 1.0 with refinement to 0.3 around holes.</task>
user
Generate a meshing task.
assistant

<task>Create a 10x10x10 box and mesh it for thermal analysis. Create physical groups: 'hot_face' for the top surface, 'cold_face' for the bottom surface, 'volume' for the solid. Use element size 1.0.</task>

<task>Create a hollow cylinder (outer radius 5, inner radius 3, height 20) for pipe flow analysis. Cut the inner cylinder from the outer. Physical groups: 'inlet' for bottom annular face, 'outlet' for top annular face, 'inner_wall' for inner surface, 'outer_wall' for outer surface, 'pipe_volume' for the solid. Use element size 0.5.</task>

<task>Create an L-bracket by fusing two boxes: vertical arm (10x50x5) and horizontal arm (40x10x5) sharing a corner. Add two 3mm radius cylindrical mounting holes in the horizontal arm at positions (10,5) and (30,5). Physical groups: 'mounting_holes' for hole surfaces, 'fixed_face' for the top of vertical arm, 'bracket_volume' for solid. Use element size 1.0 with refinement to 0.3 around holes.</task>

<task>Create a 50x50x50 cube with a 10mm radius cylindrical hole drilled through it along the z-axis. Cut the hole from the cube. Physical groups: 'cavity' for hole surface, 'cube_volume' for solid. Use element size 5.0.</task>

<task>Create a sphere (radius 10) with a 5mm radius cylindrical cavity at its center. Intersect the cavity with the sphere. Physical groups: 'cavity' for inner surface, 'sphere_volume' for solid. Use element size 2.0.</task>

<task>Create a plate (10x10x0.5) with two 5mm radius cylindrical holes at positions (3,3) and (7,7). Add a 3mm radius cylindrical protrusion at (5,5) with height 5. Physical groups: 'holes' for hole surfaces, 'protrusion' for protrusion surface, 'plate_volume' for solid. Use element size 1.0.</task>

<task>Create a 20x20x10 box with a 5mm radius cylindrical hole at (10,10,5). Add a 3mm radius cylindrical protrusion at (10,10,0). Physical groups: 'hole' for hole surface, 'protrusion' for protrusion surface, 'box_volume' for solid. Use element size 2.0.</task>

<task>Create a 50x50x50 cube with a 10mm radius cylindrical hole drilled through it along the z-axis. Add a 5mm radius cylindrical protrusion at (25,25,0). Physical groups: 'cavity' for hole surface, 'protrusion' for protrusion surface, 'cube_volume' for solid. Use element size 5.0.</task>

<task>Create a sphere (radius 10) with a 5mm radius cylindrical cavity at its center. Add a 3mm radius cylindrical protrusion at (0,0,5). Physical groups: 'cavity' for inner surface, 'protrusion' for protrusion surface, 'sphere_volume' for solid. Use element size 2.0.</task>

<task>Create a 10x10x10 box with a 5mm radius cylindrical hole at (5,5,5). Add a 3mm radius cylindrical protrusion at (5,5,0). Physical groups: 'hole' for hole surface, 'protrusion' for protrusion surface, 'box_volume' for solid. Use element size 2.0.</task>

<task>Create a 20x20x10 box with a 5mm radius cylindrical hole at (10,10,5). Add a 3mm radius cylindrical protrusion at (10,10,0). Physical groups: 'hole' for hole surface, 'protrusion' for protrusion surface, 'box_volume' for solid. Use element size 2.0.</task>

<task>Create a 50x50x50 cube with a 10mm radius cylindrical hole drilled through it along the z-axis. Add a 5mm radius cylindrical protrusion at (25,25,0). Physical groups: 'cavity' for hole surface, 'protrusion' for protrusion surface, 'cube_volume' for solid. Use element size 5.0.</task>

<task>Create a sphere (radius 10) with a 5mm radius cylindrical cavity at

<task>Create a 10x10x10 box and mesh it for thermal analysis. Create physical groups: 'hot_face' for the top surface, 'cold_face' for the bottom surface, 'volume' for the solid. Use element size 1.0.</task>

<task>Create a hollow cylinder (outer radius 5, inner radius 3, height 20) for pipe flow analysis. Cut the inner cylinder from the outer. Physical groups: 'inlet' for bottom annular face, 'outlet' for top annular face, 'inner_wall' for inner surface, 'outer_wall' for outer surface, 'pipe_volume' for the solid. Use element size 0.5.</task>

<task>Create an L-bracket by fusing two boxes: vertical arm (10x50x5) and horizontal arm (40x10x5) sharing a corner. Add two 3mm radius cylindrical mounting holes in the horizontal arm at positions (10,5) and (30,5). Physical groups: 'mounting_holes' for hole surfaces, 'fixed_face' for the top of vertical arm, 'bracket_volume' for solid. Use element size 1.0 with refinement to 0.3 around holes.</task>

<task>Create a 20x20x10 box with a 5x5x10 cylindrical hole centered in the middle. The hole should have a 2mm radius. Physical groups: 'hole' for the cylindrical surface, 'box_volume' for the remaining solid. Use element size 0.5 with refinement to 0.2 around the hole.</task>

<task>Create a 10x10x10 sphere with a 2mm radius cylindrical cavity centered in the middle. The cavity should have a 1mm radius. Physical groups: 'cavity' for the cylindrical surface, 'sphere_volume' for the remaining solid. Use element size 1.0 with refinement to 0.5 around the cavity.</task>

<task>Create a 10x10x10 box with a 5x5x10 cylindrical hole centered in the middle. The hole should have a 2mm radius. Add a 3mm radius cylindrical mounting hole in the center of the top face. Physical groups: 'hole' for the cylindrical surfaces, 'box_volume' for the remaining solid. Use element size 0.5 with refinement to 0.2 around the holes.</task>

<task>Create a 10x10x10 box with a 5x5x10 cylindrical hole centered in the middle. The hole should have a 2mm radius. Add a 3mm radius cylindrical mounting hole in the center of the top face. Add a 5mm radius spherical cavity centered in the middle of the box. Physical groups: 'hole' for the cylindrical surfaces, 'cavity' for the spherical surface, 'box_volume' for the remaining solid. Use element size 0.5 with refinement to 0.2 around the holes and 0.5 around the cavity.</task>

<task>Create a 10x10x10 box with a 5x5x10 cylindrical hole centered in the middle. The hole should have a 2mm radius. Add a 3mm radius cylindrical mounting hole in the center of the top face. Add a 5mm radius spherical cavity centered in the middle of the box. Add a 2mm radius cylindrical cavity centered in the middle of the bottom face. Physical groups: 'hole' for the cylindrical surfaces, 'cavity' for the spherical and cylindrical surfaces, 'box_volume' for the remaining solid. Use element size 0.5 with refinement to 0.2 around the holes and 0.5 around the cavities.</task>

<task>Create a 10x10x10 box with a 5x5x10 cylindrical hole centered in the middle. The hole should have a 2mm radius. Add a 3mm radius cylindrical mounting hole in the center of the top face. Add a 5mm radius spherical cavity centered in the middle of the box. Add a 2mm radius cylindrical cavity centered in the middle of the bottom face. Add a 4mm radius cylindrical cavity centered in the middle of the front face. Physical groups: 'hole' for the cylindrical surfaces, 'cavity' for the spherical and cylindrical surfaces, 'box_volume' for the remaining solid. Use element size 0.5 with refinement to 0.2 around the holes and 0.5 around the cavities.</task>
